column4: im trying to install a wireless driver, i dont kinow how to build it after downloading the zipped file
what model is your wireless card?
atheros 5007 i think, i have the proper driver i believe, so thats not the issue, its installing the driver.
you're trying to use ndiswrapper? or it is a native linux driver and trying to compile it?
yes, it is native. try this: http://linux-wireless.org/Install-HOWTO/Drivers/madwifi/0.Howto.Install.Madwifi.txt
I don't have a wireless card, so I can't try anything...
no i dont think that works for the particular driver i have. i think i jsut need to learn how to build from the .tar file

it should be how any "normal" package compiles: extract the tar, and inside of the folder containing the extracted file, run "./configure", then "make" and then "sudo make install". That should install it.
because you have to change into the extracted files. imagine that the files extracted to a certain "madwifi-obi" folder. you have to type "cd madwifi-obi" to change into that directory.
oh so the individual files. there are a ton of files, need i do this to all of them?
no. i'm going to guide you step by step. delete all the files extracted. tell when done.
